questions.text: What is the most likely diagnosis for a 13-year-old boy with a history of chronic and recurrent itchy flexural lesions, considering his family history of asthma? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Atopic dermatitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Identify atopic dermatitis as a chronic, pruritic inflammatory skin disease commonly associated with flexural distribution of eczematous lesions and a family history of atopic conditions, such as asthma.
  • ➤ atopic dermatitis
  • ➤ chronic, pruritic inflammatory
  • ➤ flexural distribution
  • ➤ family history

questions.text: Which of the following can alter the gene expression by methylation and acetylation but not change the gene sequence? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Epigenetics

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epigenetics has been defined and today is generally accepted as ‘‘ the study of changes in gene function that are mitotically and/or meiotically heritable and that do not entail a change in DNA sequence.
  • ➤ the study of changes in gene function that are mitotically and/or meiotically heritable and that do not entail a change in DNA sequence.
  • ➤ Epigenetic modification of core histones (acetylation of specific lysine residues) facilitates an open structure and permits access to transcription factors for interaction with DNA. On the other hand, methylation at the CG sequence of the promoters transcriptionally inactivates chromatin.

questions.text: The Bragg peak effect is pronounced in: (NEET PG 2018)

  • ➤ Proton beam therapy characteristics:

  • ➤ It has marked effect with increased depth in the soft tissues.
  • ➤ Bragg's peak is their peculiar feature.
  • ➤ Ideal agents for treating deep seated tumors.
  • ➤ Ideal agents for treating deep seated tumors.
  • ➤ Agent of choice for treatment of clival chordomas.

questions.text: Calculate the mid parental height of a male patient with father height 183 cm and mother height 175 cm? ( FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 185.5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ To calculate the mid-parental height for a male child, use the formula:
  • ➤ (Father’s height+Mother’s height)/2+6.5 cm.

questions.text: In a village, the residents find a new groundwater source. After intake of water from this source many villagers presented with nausea, vomiting, dark bloody stools, conjunctivitis, and a burning sensation in the throat and stomach. Which poisoning do you suspect in this case? ( INICET Nov 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Arsenic

questions.text: A patient has mental retardation, seizures, thrombotic state, amino acid metabolism disorder, osteoporosis, and ectopia lentis. Which vitamin must be supplemented to the patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Homocystinuria is characterized by ectopia lentis, thrombotic state, mental retardation, and seizures, among other features. Vitamin B6 supplementation is essential in managing this condition by aiding the function of the deficient enzyme cystathionine beta-synthase.

questions.text: What is the most common cause of ventriculomegaly in newborns? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Aqueductal stenosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aqueductal stenosis is the leading cause of ventriculomegaly in newborns due to the narrowing or obstruction of the cerebral aqueduct, leading to hydrocephalus.

questions.text: What constitutes the primary administrative unit in India? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) District

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The district serves as the principal administrative unit in India, playing a vital role in governance and implementation of government policies at the grassroots level.

questions.text: Which of the following is the Information Communication Technology based Surveillance system for TB patients under National TB Elimination Program? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Nikshay

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nikshay is the ICT-based surveillance system used for TB patients under the National TB Elimination Program in India. It enables real-time data collection and monitoring of TB cases across the country.

questions.text: Which of the following is a PCSK9 inhibitor? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Evolocumab

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Evolocumab is a PCSK9 inhibitor that works by blocking the PCSK9 enzyme, leading to increased LDL receptor availability on liver cells and reduced LDL cholesterol levels in the blood.

questions.text: A woman with a history of infertility is on treatment with human gonadotropin. She presented with the following finding in the USG. What is the most likely diagnosis? ( NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ OHSS is characterized by multiple enlarged ovarian follicles and fluid accumulation in the pelvic cavity, often occurring after exogenous gonadotropin administration in infertility treatments.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 456, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 456, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: A child presents to the emergency department with a history of ingestion of 10-20 ferrous sulfate tablets. Arterial blood gas revealed acidosis. Which of the following can be used in the management of this condition? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Whole Bowel Irrigation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Whole Bowel Irrigation with polyethylene glycol is the preferred method for managing iron tablet ingestion, especially when iron tablets are visible on an abdominal X-ray.
  • ➤ Whole Bowel Irrigation with polyethylene glycol is the preferred method for managing iron tablet ingestion, especially when iron tablets are visible on an abdominal X-ray.

questions.text: A 10-year-old child with a known history of Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus presents to the emergency department with symptoms of increased thirst, frequent urination, abdominal pain, and confusion. On examination, the child appears dehydrated and is breathing rapidly. Laboratory tests reveal a blood glucose level of 400 mg/dl and blood gas analysis is indicative of acidosis. Initial treatment with intravenous fluids has been started. What is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Initiate an insulin intravenous infusion at 0.1 units/kg/hour

options.label: B
options.text: Give an insulin stat dose of 0.1 units/kg intravenously, followed by an infusion at 0.1 units/kg/hour

options.label: C
options.text: Administer normal saline for the first hour followed by insulin infusion at 0.1 units/kg/hour

options.label: D
options.text: Continue with intravenous fluids without insulin administration

questions.correct_answer: C. Administer normal saline for the first hour followed by insulin infusion at 0.1 units/kg/hour
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)Administer normal saline for the first hour followed by insulin infusion at 0.1 units/kg/hour

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ According to latest guidelines for management of DKA in children first IV fulids are administered for one hour, then insulin is adminsitered by IV infusion at a rate of 0.1 U/kg/hour.

questions.text: Which of the following is not glucogenic?(INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Acetyl coenzyme A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acetyl CoA is not a glucogenic compound as it cannot be directly converted into glucose, unlike oxaloacetate, lactate, and pyruvate, which are glucogenic and contribute to glucose synthesis.
  • ➤ Substrates of gluconeogenesis (mostly 3C)
  • ➤ Substrates of gluconeogenesis (mostly 3C)
  • ➤ Pyruvate (3C) Lactate (3C) Propionic acid (3C) Glycerol (3C) Glucogenic amino acids (18 amino acids) Both Ketogenic & Glucogenic amino acids Any TCA Intermediate (forms oxaloacetate which can enter gluconeogenesis)
  • ➤ Pyruvate (3C)
  • ➤ Lactate (3C)
  • ➤ Propionic acid (3C)
  • ➤ Glycerol (3C)
  • ➤ Glucogenic amino acids (18 amino acids)
  • ➤ Both Ketogenic & Glucogenic amino acids
  • ➤ Any TCA Intermediate (forms oxaloacetate which can enter gluconeogenesis)

questions.text: In PALS ABCDE all pairs are matched correctly except? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true regarding cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection? (INICET NOV 2022) Neonates who are asymptomatic at birth have a lesser risk of later sequelae. 20-40% are symptomatic at birth. In developing countries, the rate of transmission of CMV infection to the infant is more common from primary maternal infection than reactivation. Diagnosis by urine specimen at 4 weeks of age
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1, 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neonates who are asymptomatic at birth from congenital CMV infection have a lower risk of long-term sequelae, and transmission is more common from primary maternal infection than from reactivation, especially in developing countries.

questions.text: A patient of sickle cell anemia developed aplastic crisis after a viral infection. The agent causing it is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Parvovirus B19

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Parvovirus B19 is the primary viral agent responsible for causing aplastic crisis in patients with sickle cell anemia due to its affinity for and destruction of erythroid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

questions.text: A patient suffered from tibial fracture following a road traffic accident. He complained of pain on passive flexion. His posterior tibial and dorsalis pedis pulses were palpable, but he had loss of sensation in the 1st webspace. What will be the next step? (INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Measure anterior compartment pressure

questions.text: Which of the following is the earliest marker for myocardial infarction? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ischemia modified albumin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ischemia modified albumin (IMA) is an early biomarker for myocardial infarction, detectable shortly after ischemia begins, and is particularly valuable for its ability to rule out MI when levels are normal.

questions.text: Identify the stage of sleep based on the EEG shown below: (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ REM sleep is characterized by EEG patterns similar to wakefulness, rapid eye movements on EOG, and muscle atonia on EMG.

questions.text: During disaster management, triage is conducted to ensure proper treatment of casualties. What are the accurate aspects of the triage process carried out at the site of the disaster? (NEET PG 2019)

options.label: B
options.text: Green labels are for those who need to be transported on priority

options.label: C
options.text: Moribund patients receive the lowest priority

options.label: D
options.text: Most commonly used system is three color code system

questions.correct_answer: C. Moribund patients receive the lowest priority
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Moribund patients receive the lowest priority

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In disaster triage, moribund patients receive the lowest priority, allowing medical resources to be focused on patients with a higher chance of survival.

questions.text: A 2-year-old child with stable vitals and ECG showing PSVT. What is the appropriate management? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Adenosine 0.1 mg/kg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For stable PSVT in children, adenosine is the first-line treatment, starting at a dose of 0.1 mg/kg. If this dose is ineffective, the dose may be escalated in subsequent attempts.

questions.text: A man habitually consumes coffee before bedtime and claims difficulty in sleep during night. What is the role of caffeine in wakefulness? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Blocks adenosine action and causes wakefulness

options.label: B
options.text: Activates locus coeruleus and cause wakefulness

options.label: C
options.text: No role in maintaining wakefulness if taken 1hr before sleep

options.label: D
options.text: Activates histamine release and prevents sleep

questions.correct_answer: A. Blocks adenosine action and causes wakefulness
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Blocks adenosine action and causes wakefulness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Caffeine promotes wakefulness primarily by blocking adenosine receptors in the brain, thereby preventing the sleep-inducing effects of adenosine.

questions.text: Erythropoietin is secreted by which of the following? (INICET MAY 2024) a. Liver b. Kidney c. Spleen d. Heart
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) a, b

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Erythropoietin is primarily produced by the kidneys (90%) and to a lesser extent by the liver (10%). These organs are the main sources of erythropoietin in the human body, with the kidneys playing a dominant role in its regulation and production in response to hypoxia.

questions.text: Identify the type of ANA staining pattern shown in the image below? (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Centromeric

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Centromeric pattern in ANA staining is associated with anti-centromere antibodies and limited scleroderma.

questions.text: A young boy came to Derma OPD with complaints of severe itching at night. On examination, burrows are seen over intertriginous areas, axillae, umbilicus, and between digits. The disease is transmitted by? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Mite

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Scabies is caused by the mite Sarcoptes scabiei var. hominis , which burrows into the skin, causing intense itching, particularly at night, and burrows in characteristic areas such as the axillae, umbilicus, and between the digits.
  • ➤ Sarcoptes scabiei var. hominis

questions.text: A child with acute lymphoblastic leukemia undergoes prophylactic irradiation prior to autologous hematopoietic stem cell transplantation. Which of the following will be the least affected? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Neurons

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Neurons (Central nervous system) are the least affected by irradiation among the options given, due to their highly differentiated and non-dividing nature.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option. A. Spermatogonia : These are germ cells that continually divide and are highly sensitive to radiation, which can lead to infertility.
  • • Option. A. Spermatogonia
  • • Option. B. Intestinal epithelial cells : These cells have a high turnover rate, making them very sensitive to radiation, which can result in gastrointestinal toxicity.
  • • Option. B. Intestinal epithelial cells
  • • Option. D. Bone marrow/erythroid precursor cells : These cells are among the most sensitive to radiation due to their role in rapidly producing new blood cells, leading to potential marrow suppression.
  • • Option. D. Bone marrow/erythroid precursor cells

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about vitamin K? ( NEET PG 2018)

options.label: A
options.text: Deficiency of vitamin K leads to hypercoagulability.

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged use of antibiotics leads to vitamin K deficiency.

options.text: Menaquinone is the dietary source of vitamin K found in green vegetables.

questions.explanation: Ans. C) Prolonged use of antibiotics leads to Vitamin K deficiency

questions.text: The persistence of ADHD in childhood increases the risk of development of which of the following in adolescence? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Conduct disorder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The persistence of ADHD in childhood significantly increases the risk of developing conduct disorder during adolescence, highlighting the need for early and effective management of ADHD symptoms.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is false for descriptors of central tendency? ( INICET MAY 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Mode is affected by extreme values

options.label: B
options.text: Mean is affected by extreme values

options.label: C
options.text: Median is calculated by overall observations

options.label: D
options.text: Mode can be used as a qualitative data descriptor

questions.correct_answer: A. Mode is affected by extreme values
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mode is affected by extreme values

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The mode is not affected by extreme values and can be used to describe qualitative data. In contrast, the mean is affected by extreme values, and the median is a robust measure of central tendency that is calculated using overall observations.
  • ➤ The mode is not affected by extreme values and can be used to describe qualitative data.
  • ➤ In contrast, the mean is affected by extreme values, and the median is a robust measure of central tendency that is calculated using overall observations.

questions.text: A 65-year-old female patient weighing 60 kg is on mechanical ventilation for ARDS secondary to urosepsis. The respiratory parameters are as follows: tidal volume- 360 mL; frequency- 30 breaths/min; PEEP- 5 cm of H2O; and FiO2- 90%. The arterial blood gas findings are as follows: paO2- 50 mmHg; paCO2- 38 mmHg and pH- 7.38. What is the next step? ( INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Increase PEEP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In ARDS management, if the patient remains hypoxemic despite a high FiO2, the next step is to increase the PEEP to improve oxygenation while maintaining lung-protective ventilation strategies.

questions.text: Which of the following can be prevented by folic acid supplementation in pregnancy? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Neural tube defects

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Folic acid supplementation before and during early pregnancy is essential to prevent neural tube defects in the developing fetus.

questions.text: A patient suffered from severe chest pain and expired. Which of the following is the likely age of infarct from the image of the cardiac biopsy shown here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1 day

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brisk neutrophilic infiltration is a characteristic finding in myocardial tissue within the first 24 hours of infarction. The peak of neutrophil presence occurs around the second and third days , followed by the transition to macrophages.
  • ➤ The peak of neutrophil presence occurs
  • ➤ around the second and third days

questions.text: Which require maximum energy for assimilation? ( INICET Nov 2021)

Ans. A) Proteins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Proteins require the maximum energy for assimilation among the options listed, as they need to be broken down into individual amino acids for various metabolic processes, including energy production.

questions.text: Identify the anti-apoptotic factor among the following: (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Bcl-2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bcl-2's anti-apoptotic properties make it a key player in cellular survival and stress response. Its ability to inhibit key steps in the apoptotic process distinguishes it from other proteins like P-53, K-ras, and BAK, which have different roles in the regulation of cell death and proliferation.

questions.text: A poor farmer with a history of successive crop failure develops progressive spastic paraparesis, signs of upper motor neuron paralysis, and gait instability. Name the toxin responsible for this condition.(NEET PG 2023)

questions.text: A 60-year-old postmenopausal woman comes with a history of Colles’ fracture 6 months ago. Her DEXA scan reveals T score of -2.5. What is the next best step?(INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Alendronate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Vibrio cholerae binds with which receptors in the intestine? ( FMGE July 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) GM1

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Vibrio cholerae causes cholera, a disease characterized by severe watery diarrhea, often referred to as "rice water stools." The pathogenesis of cholera involves the cholera toxin, which plays a critical role in the disease process.
  • • Upon ingestion of contaminated food or water, Vibrio cholerae produces cholera toxin in the intestinal lumen. The cholera toxin (2 subunits – A & B) does not enter the intestinal cells directly; instead, it binds to the GM1 ganglioside receptor on the surface of the intestinal epithelial cells. This binding facilitates the entry of the toxin into the cells.
  • • Once inside the cell, the cholera toxin activates the enzyme adenylate cyclase, leading to an increase in cyclic AMP (cAMP) levels. Elevated cAMP levels cause the inhibition of sodium absorption and an increase in chloride and water secretion into the intestinal lumen. This results in the characteristic watery diarrhea of cholera.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. GM2: This ganglioside receptor is not involved in the binding of cholera toxin.
  • • Option B. GM2:
  • • Option C. GM3: This ganglioside receptor is not involved in the binding of cholera toxin.
  • • Option C. GM3:
  • • Option D. GM4: This ganglioside receptor is not involved in the binding of cholera toxin.
  • • Option D. GM4:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cholera toxin produced by Vibrio cholerae binds to the GM1 ganglioside receptor on the intestinal epithelial cells, leading to an increase in cyclic AMP and resulting in watery diarrhea.
